choices.D: The reverse shaper option must be enabled and a traffic shaper must be selected.
choices.B: The guaranteed-10mbps option must be selected as the reverse shaper option.
choices.A: The guaranteed-10mbps option must be selected as the per-IP shaper option.
choices.C: A new firewall policy must be created and SD-WAN must be selected as the incoming interface.
The protected subnets should be set to address object to all (0.0.0.0/0).

choices.A: ADVPN should only be enabled on unmanaged FortiGate devices.
choices.B: Each VPN device has a unique pre-shared key configured separately on phase one.

questions.question_text: Which two statements describe how IPsec phase 1 main mode id different from aggressive mode when performing IKE negotiation? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Refer to this article: https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-Differences-between-Aggressive-and-Main-mode-in/ta-p/196313

I believe it is B and C by process of elimination. Since A is a characteristic of aggressive mode and that is not the question, and D is not mentioned in the curriculum. C is definitely a valid difference, but B is the only one left, even though it is a configurable feature in both modes.

Selected Answer: AC
A and C

A and C are correct

Peer ID is included in the initiating packet - Aggressive Mode // in Main mode is included in the packet 5. 

Main mode 6 packets // Aggresive mode only three 

what b says is correct but it is not a difference between the two modes, you can enable Xauth in both modes, is a phase 1.5.
